result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald Terrell Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
*   Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
*   Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by 10/10/2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
*   Successfully complete Anger Management.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald Terrell Allen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Successfully complete Anger Management.
     *   Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
     *   No contact with victim.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA surcharge)
          by 10/10/2017. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.   

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights, received and filed

Defendant Reginald Terrell Allen in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  


Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Reginald Terrell Allen in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial. Defense counsel requests a projected guilty plea date. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald Terrell Allen in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm 

Case in court on status on counsel. Defense counsel requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case remains calendared in Branch 47.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 27th Street tobacco shop and Midhatn F.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb

Defendant Reginald Terrell Allen in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Reginald Terrell Allen not in court.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
